climbs.name: Willy Nilly
climbs.fa: Will Crljenko, Herb and Eve Laeger 1989

content.description: Climb the dihedral and break out right into the hand crack whenever you feel comfortable. Lieback around the roof and continue up to the anchors. Crux was transitioning to the hand crack, the roof goes quite easily actually. 70m rope will get you to the platform you start on, but not to the ground when lowering. Make sure your belayer ties a knot and the end of the rope.
content.protection: Pro to 2". Emphasis on small to finger size until the hand crack. .5-1 BD cams worked well for that section.
content.location: Left side of the wall. Can't miss it, just keep walking till it opens up. There are some 5.9's to the right of this that look fun as well.

content.description: Prominent crack on the right side of Crocodile Dome.  Head up an obvious crack to a sloping ledge, then up an off-width right facing dihedral (there's some loose rock here, be careful).  Chains are on the right.
content.protection: Doubles to #3.  A #4 might be helpful on the last section. Chain anchor.
content.location: Right of the wall with Don't Leave It To Granite.  From there, head over some boulders and through the bushes past a large tree.  Once you see the crack, you've arrived.

content.description: Route starts off a block from the right and heads straight up a dark groove/runnel. Crux is bolts 3-5. After you cross the runnel and clip the 5th bolt, easier climbing leads up and left to anchor. Guidebook rates 5.11a
content.protection: 9 bolts, chain anchor (shared with Croc Rock and King Lizard routes to left of Poacher).
content.location: Center of Crocodile Dome, right of route King Lizard and left of Little Baby Jesus.

content.description: follow right hand seam to overlap, finish at anchors shared with Croc Rock, Poacher, etc
Trend up and left from easy flakes to the corner shared with Sunday School (crux). Felt pretty stiff for the 5.7 it gets in the guidebook.
content.protection: Standard rack. Shares anchor with Sunday School.

content.description: Climb up an arete and traverse left to a tricky roof.  Pull the roof and head up a shallow black chimney to the anchors.
content.protection: bolted, chain anchor. Runners would be helpful.
content.location: On the right side of the wall near the left facing corner. Make sure to head left when two bolt lines appear (the right line is Croc Rock).

content.description: Tricky, moves off the deck to the first clip (stick clip recommended for those under 6' tall) then technical face climbing above with an exciting tiny knob hold. After the first few bolts the climbing eases to the typical Shuteye vertical plate pulling
content.location: This is the farthest sport climb on the left side of the cliff.

content.description: Left side of the wall, just left of a prominent black streak. Head up a thin seam to a shallow roof.  Pull the roof and continue on the face to the chains.
content.location: left side of the wall just left of a prominent black streak. The section of the wall between Willy Nilly and Don't Take It For Granite.

content.description: Climb arete right of crack , fun jugs to fun roof.
content.location: To the right of Don't Take It For Granite.

content.description: This is a great face pitch on superb rock.  The guidebook calls it bolts only, but at the very top there is a 30 ft run to the anchor.  However, a very good cam (1"-1.25") can be placed to cut that distance in half.  There is also a good horn to be slung slightly right of this gear placement that eases the thought of a long fall.
content.protection: 6 draws for the bolts, a cam for the upper runout (1"-1.25"), sling for the horn up high, and an optional large (3 or 4 ") cam for the start.
content.location: Two routes right of the very obvious corner that is Willy Nilly.  Don't take the first unless you are seeking the 10b R/X called Flying Hammerheads.

content.description: Route looks great, crux is passing the first bolt. Getting to the first bolt required gear, I placed a #1 camalot. Looks like two moves after the first bolt the difficulty eases substantially. We whipped a bunch and bailed. Give it a go!
content.protection: Couple pieces from 1"-3" for the start would help, 4 bolts and 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Right of arrowhead, bolt line above the block over there.

content.description: Start out in a wide crack which leads to a large gapping horizontal crack. Make a hilarious move into the horizontal crack and then move onto the bolted face above for the real action.
content.protection: Single set of cams 2-4" to protect the initial wide crack, then 8 bolts on the face.
content.location: To the right of Willy Nilly. Start in the obvious wide crack.

content.description: Layback up the flake to left of Sunday School. Head into a tricky slab (crux) before pulling on some big jugs and fun moves through a steep roof. Easy chickenheads and slab to the anchor
content.location: Starts on the flake to the left of Sunday School. Follow the bolts

content.description: Fun style of climbing on good rock. This route needs traffic to clean it up, but otherwise it's good. Stem, chimney, jam, or do whatever gets you up. There are so many options!
content.protection: Gear to 4", bolted anchor no rap rings, walk off the back
content.location: Behind arrowhead formation in the large crack you walk through. This climb starts at the culmination of two walls, a crack, and a block. Basically, climb up the dead center between all the walls and use the crack that takes gear for pro. Had green lichen on it when I did it

content.description: Awesome overhanging wall with scaly plates. Gain a stem to rest before heading out left. Be careful with the stem though, there are some loose pieces - the belayer should wear a helmet.
content.location: Just left of Belly of the Beast (12a) and right of Crocodile Hunter (11c).

climbs.name: Bible Study
climbs.fa: Doug Englekirk, Tom Slater, Ken Klis, August 2010

content.description: Start on the bulge flake to the left of the big crack and then up the broken seem. A few balance feet and very flared hands brings up into the upper seam. Delicate until joining Sunday School.
content.protection: Gear to 3" since you finish on the off width / hands on Sunday school. However, its pretty flared and unprotect able through the middle part. Gear a little shallow when you can plug it.
content.location: Just to the right of Sunday School over a flake and up a seem.

content.description: Start by going up the left side of the leaning block. Layback the runnel and transition into larger features above the roof.

climbs.name: Arrowhead
climbs.fa: J. Ross, J. Ross, C. Sutherland

content.description: Climb featured plates to steep headwall w/3 bolts
content.protection: gear + 3 bolts, 2 bolt anchor w/rap tat & rings
content.location: far right side of croc dome

climbs.name: After a while
climbs.fa: Bryan Schmitz and Chris Tirrell, July 2020

content.description: Just left of Crocodile Tears, climb techy moves down low to the overhanging diagonal rail to the 5.9 corner above. 4 bolts down low with some gear and then all gear in the corner above. Another optional finish is to move right to finish on the upper bolts of crocodile tears after clipping the fourth bolt.
